title: November Time!
body:
How is it that November is only a few days away? We've been so caught up planning ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW that we've lost track of time. So, without further ado, here's a quick snapshot of the weeks to come:

KURT COBAIN ABOUT A SON starts on Friday, November 2 and runs through Tuesday, November 6. Kurt Cobain About a Son is an intimate and moving meditation on the late musician and artist Kurt Cobain, based on more than 25 hours of previously unheard audiotaped interviews conducted with Cobain by noted music journalist Michael Azerrad for his book Come As You Are: The Story of Nirvana. In the film, Kurt Cobain recounts his own life - from his childhood and adolescence to his days of musical discovery and later dealings with explosive fame - and offers often piercing insights into his life, music, and times. The conversations heard in the film have never before been made public and they reveal a highly personal portrait of an artist much discussed but not particularly well understood.

Director AJ Schnack will be in attendance at The Moxie for a Q&A on Sunday, November 4. Showtimes that evening are 7:00 pm and 9:15 pm. Get your ticket early, because we anticipate big crowds! Online tickets will be available starting on Monday 10/29.

Also opening on Friday is the highly anticipated THE 11TH HOUR, which is Leo DiCaprio's new on doc on global warming. This film kicks off a month-long theme of "nature fighting back" along with THE LAST WINTER and INTO THE WILD.

We should have our print calendars and online schedule available late Monday afternoon. Dan is furiously pecking away on his computer trying to get everything finished (at least, I think that's what he's working on...I hear a lot of giggling, so he may just be looking at pictures of his Where's Waldo costume).



Anyways. To satisfy your thirst of all things Moxie, we present you with a timetable of upcoming films:

Kurt Cobain About A Son: Nov. 2 - 6
The 11th Hour: Nov. 2 - 13
I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With: Nov. 7 - 13
The Last Winter: Nov. 14 - 20
Into The Wild: Nov. 14 - 20
Moxie Shorts: Nov. 16 - 18
Lars and the Real Girl: Nov. 21 - TBA
Great World of Sound: Nov. 23 - 25
Sleuth: Nov. 28 - TBA

And if you need more Halloween goodness, I leave you with a picture of Meat Head, the snackable centerpiece we created. Because who doesn't want to peel meat off a skull? Sorry, you won't find this at The Cinebar.
author: Nicole

comments.author: Cosmik
comments.body: You know you could make a fortune selling meatheads around this time of year.  :)

comments.author: Master RJ
comments.body: November 1st must be a hibernation day.

comments.author: The Four Finger Soc Em
comments.body:
Photos courtesy of Max Rosen.

Usually Nicole makes a big deal about the fact that it's her writing a blog post and not Dan when she writes one. Seeing as it says it was written by Dan. Hmm.

I love Meat Head and the pumpkins with their varying physical disorders.

nicole Director AJ Schnack will be in attendance at The Moxie for a Q&A on Sunday, November 2.

Just watch for a new Facebook profile picture at the end of the week... *grin*

Looks like:

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Ah, but you're forgetting the best part: cranberry sauce as a binding agent. Then when you start peeling away the layers of turkey - BAM - there's bloody brain goo.

comments.body: TouchÃ©, Nic... touchÃ©.

comments.author: Cosmik
comments.body:
That's what I was missing. The cranberry sauce. :)

(Seriously - you just slather one side of the meat with sauce and stick? Cause I wanna try this.) :)

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I can't take all the credit. My friend Whitney and I made it, and we found it in the Halloween edition of MAKE Magazine. They used Jell-o, but I like the idea of cranberry sauce better. We just smudged cranberry sauce all over his head and then layered the meat. We had to use a few toothpicks to hold stuff in place.
